data.title: Default Live Preview. HTML. Not updated at change a attached files
data.body:
Preview is not updated when you change the stylesheets, and scripts attached to the html file using the tags `link` and `script`.

- VSCode Version:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20635340/07712d10-b36d-11e6-944b-8d88b161c2ae.png)

- OS Version: Linux Mint 18 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
Files from the example: [test-files.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/613889/test-files.zip)

1. If I embed the styles and scripts directly in the html, when you change the code preview is updated.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20635451/3bb93dfa-b36e-11e6-9249-5c69432d6924.png)

2. If I use the tags `link` and `script` code changes not covered in the preview.

sample html
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20635495/babb10ce-b36e-11e6-91dd-0482218ed8c2.png)

change code in file `test2.js`, the changes are not applied
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20635497/c0300334-b36e-11e6-8562-83f6bc9777a1.png)

data.title: Mac: No keyboard shortcut for opening the current file in Explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1

There does not seem to be a keyboard shortcut for opening the currently selected file in Explorer.  If I hit `Return` then I can rename the file.  If I hit `Ctrl-Return` then the file is opened to the side.  If I hit `Space` nothing useful seems to happen.  If I hit `Command-O` then a file chooser window opens.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a project in VSCode.
2. Hit Command-Shift-E to focus the Explorer
3. Use the cursor keys to navigate to a file, say `foo.js`.
4. Try to open that file by hitting some key.  I tried `Return` (renames), `Ctrl-Return` (opens in another column, it's not what I want), `Space` (does nothing), `Command-O` (opens a window that allows me to choose a file, and the default is not connected to the file I've selected.

Of course, double-clicking works.  But I'm a keyboard junkie.

data.title: Gitlab support
data.body:
Feature Request:

As many plugins works with github, none of them support Gitlab which is a great alternative totally free (as free software) and very popular.
I'd love to have something simular as Github Issues (by HookieQR) for gitlab; share code with gitlab snippets; anything about it would be very appreciated.

data.body:
Hello

I would like the possibility to change individual line sizes

Use Case:
In Visual Studio I am running an extension that makes a line only containing a bracket smaller. 
I would like a similar extension for VSCode, but first it must be possible to shrink lines individually.

data.title: php code inside <script>
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2 7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f
- OS Version: 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 compilação 76

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open/create a .php file.
2. put this inside the file:

```
<script>

<?php?>

</script>
```
the closing tag swap its colors, the <\ and > goes red and the text script goes white, haven't reported this with other tags.

EDITED
I was using monokai theme, i changed it and it seems that the closing tag gets the same color scheme of the php tag.

data.title: Improve Angular2 integration
data.body:
Since vscode offer a huge support of Typescript, i found so bad that it does not support Angular2 very well. Some alternatives exists, some extensions, but many are missing.
For exemple there is no link between styles, templates and JS file yet.

Here is a list of usefull features that can be added in Typescript for some, and Angular2 for most : 
### template HTML Behaviour : 
_**Note:** For all this ones, it may be necessary to detect that file.component.html is angular2 template and not only html file._
- Autocompletion for string interpolation and methods
- CTRL+click on string interpolation go to definition
- Angular2 HTML snippets (alternative extension : [Angular 2 TypeScript Snippets](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=johnpapa.Angular2) )
- fast encapsulate current selection with **()** , **[]** or **{}** like **""** and **' '** does: #15731 

### inline HTML Behaviour : 
- missing syntax coloration (alternative extension : [angular2-inline](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=natewallace.angular2-inline) )
- command **editor.action.formatDocument** does not work properly (ALT+SHIFT+F)
- Emmet is not working ( alternative : [	Angular 2 TypeScript Emmet](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=jakethashi.vscode-angular2-emmet) )


### JS/TS Behaviour : 
- Angular2 TS snippets (alternative extension : [Angular 2 TypeScript Snippets](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=johnpapa.Angular2) )
- apply warning for unused import
- when typing some variables names in TS, ":" trigger autocompletion, exemple : #16072


### General Behaviour : 
- commands to fast switch between ts / html / sass or css files ( alternative : [angular2-switcher ](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=infinity1207.angular2-switcher) )
- autoImport required Symbol / class / methods ( alternative : [TS Importer](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=pmneo.tsimporter) )


For those who wants an **icon theme** with angular icons, here is a suggestion : [VSCode simpler Icons with Angular](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=davidbabel.vscode-simpler-icons).
For help, I suggest you to put **"html.suggest.angular1": false,** if you work on angular 2.

Feel free to support this issue adding 👍 , and add your suggestions and extension recommandations, i will edit this.

data.title: Blank lines in TS code cause breakpoints to move upon browser refresh.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10
- Debugger for Chrome extension version: 2.2.2

I drop a breakpoint into typescript code which will get hit after the page loads as expected.  I continue running in VS Code and then hit 'f5' in the browser; the breakpoint is hit again in VS Code, but the red breakpoint dot in VS Code moves up to an earlier line in the code.  The distance it moves up is equal to the number of empty lines before the breakpoint's original position.

Here's what it looks like on first run:

![On first run](https://www.dropbox.com/s/lvj0r3uq5gcw5t4/firstRun.png?raw=1)

And here's what it looks like after continuing and then hitting refresh in Chrome:

![On first run](https://www.dropbox.com/s/dap0vm0l72oxkui/afterRefresh.png?raw=1)

Apologies if this is caused by an obvious error on my part; this seems like something everyone would have hit, so I've created a minimum repro case of the issue to help demonstrate it.  I'd greatly appreciate any assistance in understanding what's going on.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download the ~4kb zipped project from here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/e8xu4157n9j3hxa/tsNSRepro.zip?dl=0
2. npm install to get the dependencies, and ensure Chrome and the Debugger for Chrome extension are both installed
3. Place a breakpoint on the "console.log" line in testApp.ts.
4. Build the project and run.  The breakpoint should be hit and appear as per first picture above
5. F5 to continue running in VS Code
6. In the browser, hit F5 to refresh the page
7. Note that in vs code the breakpoint is again hit, but the red dot has moved up the page.

Try adding/removing blank lines and repeat the above, and note how the distance the red dot moves changes accordingly.

Here's the typescript file in question:
```
// NOTE: Blank lines screw up breakpoint loc on F5.


setTimeout(function() {
    console.log("i am a test");
}, 1000);
```

... and here's the gulpfile
```
var gulp = require("gulp"),
    tsc = require("gulp-typescript"),
    sourcemaps = require("gulp-sourcemaps"),
    del = require("del"),
    runSequence = require("run-sequence");

gulp.task("clean", function () {
    return del([ "testApp.js.map", "testApp.js" ]);
});

gulp.task("build-testApp", function (cb) {
    var ts = tsc.createProject("tsconfig.json");
    return gulp.src(["testApp.ts"])
        .pipe(sourcemaps.init())
        .pipe(ts())
        .pipe(sourcemaps.write(".", { includeContent: false, sourceRoot: "." })) 
        .pipe(gulp.dest("."))
});

gulp.task("build-all", function (cb) {
    runSequence("clean", "build-testApp", cb);
});
```

And finally, here's the diagnostic logging output after performing the above steps and F5'ing a couple of times - nothing seems to imply a failure to map breakpoints...

```
Verbose logs are written to C:\Users\jeffs\.vscode\extensions\msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-2.2.2\vscode-chrome-debug.txt
8:04:15 AM, 11/25/2016
OS: win32 ia32
Adapter node: v6.5.0 ia32
vscode-chrome-debug-core: 3.6.3
debugger-for-chrome: 2.2.1
spawn('C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe', ["--remote-debugging-port=9222","--no-first-run","--no-default-browser-check","--disable-session-crashed-bubble","--disable-infobars","http://127.0.0.1:1025/index.html"])
Discovering targets via http://127.0.0.1:9222/json
Target userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/54.0.2840.99 Safari/537.36
Paths.scriptParsed: resolved http://127.0.0.1:1025/testApp.js to c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js. webRoot: c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro
SourceMaps.getMapForGeneratedPath: Finding SourceMap for c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js by URI: testApp.js.map and webRoot: c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro
SourceMaps.loadSourceMapContents: Reading local sourcemap file from c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js.map
SourceMap: creating for c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js
SourceMap: sourceRoot: .
SourceMap: sources: ["testApp.ts"]
SourceMap: webRoot: c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro
SourceMap: resolved sourceRoot . -> c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro
SourceMaps.scriptParsed: c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js was just loaded and has mapped sources: ["c:\\Users\\jeffs\\Desktop\\tsRepro\\testApp.ts"]
SourceMaps.setBP: Mapped c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.ts to c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js
SourceMaps.setBP: Mapped c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.ts:9:1 to c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js:3:5
Paths.setBP: Resolved c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js to http://127.0.0.1:1025/testApp.js
SourceMaps.setBP: Mapped c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js:3:5 to c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.ts:9
i am a test

SourceMaps.scriptParsed: c:\Users\jeffs\Desktop\tsRepro\testApp.js was just loaded and has mapped sources: ["c:\\Users\\jeffs\\Desktop\\tsRepro\\testApp.ts"]
i am a test
```

Other supporting files (tsconfig.json etc) can be found in the above linked zip file.

Thanks,

data.title: First https request is responsible for 18% of windows startup time
data.body: * windows 10, latest insiders * open a folder, close all editors, don't show viewlets * start profiling * reload * 🐌 there is call to the `getmac` node module that takes ~1 second. That call is made *always* when the extension gallery services comes up. That call is also made on first startup when telemetry data is initialised. We should consider replacing this module with [`os#networkinterfaces`](https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v6.x/docs/api/os.html#os_os_networkinterfaces)

data.title: Consider to introduce alternative syntax for ${command.xxx} variables
data.body:
With #12735 it is now possible to use any command ID in a variable with the ${command.xxxx} syntax.

If the command ID follows the common practice to use '.' as segment separators then using it with the 'command.' prefix makes things a bit unwieldy:

``` typescript
  "program": "${command.extension.node-debug.pickProcess}"
```

I suggest that we deprecate the ${prefix.id} syntax and introduce a new ${prefix:id} syntax which results in more readable variables:

``` typescript
  "program": "${command:extension.node-debug.pickProcess}"
```

This change would apply to the other variable prefixes 'env', 'config' as well (and it would help there too because 'config' uses command IDs too).

/cc @kieferrm @egamma @dbaeumer 
your opinion?

data.title: Typing should do the same for all cursors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write this file:
```css
.a {
  background: linear-gradient(red, blue 10%, green 50%)
}
```
2. Select the three colors using multiple cursors:
```css
.a {
  background: linear-gradient(|red, |blue 10%, |green 50%)
}
```
3. Now press <kbd>Backspace</kbd> to delete the three colors, and then type <kbd>(</kbd>. The first parenthesis doesn't have a closing pair.
```css
.a {
  background: linear-gradient((, () 10%, () 50%)
}
```

data.title: Debugger halts with vscode_backtrack: Internal Error
data.body:
I'm trying to find out why `this.direction` is set to `" "`and is using a conditional breakpoint in order to inspect the stacktrace when `" "`is set.

But the debugger halts with *No call stack available (vscode_backtrack: Internal Error: TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of undefined).*


- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:14:18.217Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-47-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.5.5|
|ejs-language-support|QassimFarid|0.0.1|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.25|
|vscode-apache|mrmlnc|1.1.0|
|spellchecker|swyphcosmo|1.2.3|
|ayu|teabyii|0.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone https://github.com/dotnetCarpenter/eloquent.git
2. Checkout 4b8664c3b21db4da79bba12f748bf033685d5be1
3. Add conditional breakpoint on [line 116 in lifelikeSimulation.js](https://github.com/dotnetCarpenter/eloquent/commit/4b8664c3b21db4da79bba12f748bf033685d5be1#diff-5b51c790755f118bdc69ac07110b1b6eR116)
4. The condition should be `value == " "`
5. Start the debugger with the following launch.json:
```json
{
	"version": "0.2.0",
	"configurations": [{
		"type": "node",
		"request": "launch",
		"name": "Launch Lifelike",
		"program": "${workspaceRoot}/ch07/lifelike.js",
		"cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/ch07"
	}]
}
```

data.title: Escaping in snippet text
data.body:
The snippet syntax https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/snippet/common/snippet.md#L27
says that $ can be escaped by \\$.

In addition to that:
- the escaping character needs to escapable in order to be able to have '\\$' as content in a snippet. `\` -> `\\`
- the placeholder text needs to be able to escape }   -> `}` -> `\}`

For simplicity I suggest that the spec says that any character can be escaped using \

data.title: Provide auto-updates for linux
data.body:
Users on linux still have to go to website to download updates. 

This sucks :( Would be better if we could get auto-updates like windows and mac users.
